court: IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION OFFCIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT DT.18TH NOVEMBER, 2006 IN PETITION NO.19 OF 1953 Re: Khanbahaddur Mohammed Yusuf Ahmed Pai ..Insolvent. Ex-parte: Modern Construction Co. .. Petitioning Creditor. ... Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present. CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J. 21st November, 2006. P.C. : An order of adjudication was passed on 20th October, . The Official Assignee declared a dividend @ 0.100 paise in a rupee to the unsecured creditors on their proved liability of Rs.1,71,012/- on 14th December, 1970. At present an amount in the aggregate of Rs.20,117.37 is lying to the credit of the estate account. The Official Assignee has prayed that this amount may be transferred to the unclaimed dividend capital account under Rule 178 of the Bombay Insolvency Rules, 1910 and thereafter to the unclaimed dividend capital revenue account and the account may be closed for administrative purposes. Having regard to the circumstances set out in the report of the Official Assignee, there is no reason why the prayer should not be granted. Prayer clause (a) of the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly granted.
